intro: Dysphania melanocarpa, commonly known as lambsquarters, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender, branching stalks. Its seeds are tiny, dry, and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Lambsquarters is commonly found in disturbed soils, such as agricultural fields and路边 areas.
